greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of 4*K/Pi, a constant appearing in the asymptotic evaluation of the number of non-hypotenuse numbers not exceeding a given bound, where K is the Landau-Ramanujan constant.
reference: Steven R. Finch, Mathematical Constants, Cambridge University Press, 2003, 2.3 Landau-Ramanujan Constant, p. 101.
link: Daniel Shanks, Non-hypotenuse Numbers, Fib. Quart., 13:4 (1975), pp. 319-321.
mathematica: digits = 100; LandauRamanujan[n_] := With[{K = Ceiling[Log[2, n*Log[3, 10]]]}, N[Product[(((1-2^(-2^k))*4^2^k*Zeta[2^k])/(Zeta[2^k, 1/4] - Zeta[2^k, 3/4]))^2^(-k-1), {k, 1, K}]/Sqrt[2], n]]; K = LandauRamanujan[digits+5]; RealDigits[4*K/Pi, 10, digits] // First (* after Victor Adamchik *)
results.author: _Jean-François Alcover_, Jul 04 2014
